page.title: 01A BRIEF VIEW OF OWERSBY
page.content: North Owersby the only village,and in the centre of this block lies 6 miles from Market Rasen and 20 miles from Lincoln the spires of whose cathedral can be seen from various view points. Nearby is the hamlet of S.Owersby with farms and houses scattered over the re maining area.There is 1 shop,no school no meeting place and very little new building in the block.Most of the land is intensively farmed with fields vary ing from less than 1 acre to over 200 though there is still some old pasture with rig and furrow evident.The area lies from 25 to 100ft above sea level with sandy soil in the east and clay in the west.There has been some tree replanting,much of it hardwood,both on roadside verges and in odd spots.Of a population of about 220,less than 50% of the adults work within the block. 20% are either retired or unemployed.
